title: Ticket #6328: Missing job log events
description:
Some time ago, Brian Bockelman reported a confusing series of job log events for a crondor job.

Here is the submit file: 

universe = local

environment = XRD_LOGLEVEL=Debug PYTHONUNBUFFERED=1
executable = stash-data-update
#use_x509userproxy = true
output = stash_update_logs/lastrun.out
error = stash_update_logs/lastrun.err
log = stash_update_logs/log

cron_month = *
cron_day_of_month = *
cron_day_of_week = *
cron_hour = *
cron_minute = 2

on_exit_remove = false

job_max_vacate_time = 120
when_to_transfer_output = ON_EXIT_OR_EVICT
periodic_release = true
periodic_hold = (JobStatus =?= 2) && (time()-EnteredCurrentStatus>7000)
periodic_hold_reason = "Job restarted because it was running for almost 2 hours."
periodic_hold_subcode = 2


queue

And here is the user job log: 

...
001 (45300.000.000) 03/10 12:02:01 Job executing on host: <129.93.244.222:9618?addrs=[2600-900-6-1301-5054-ff-fef2-2b0b]-9618+129.93.244.222-9618&noUDP&sock=569154_3b22_50>
...
013 (45300.000.000) 03/10 13:59:42 Job was released.
        The job attribute PeriodicRelease expression 'true' evaluated to TRUE
...
004 (45300.000.000) 03/10 14:06:03 Job was evicted.
        (0) Job was not checkpointed.
                Usr 0 00:00:00, Sys 0 00:00:00  -  Run Remote Usage
                Usr 0 00:02:39, Sys 0 00:00:59  -  Run Local Usage
        0  -  Run Bytes Sent By Job
        0  -  Run Bytes Received By Job
...
012 (45300.000.000) 03/10 14:06:03 Job was held.
        Job restarted because it was running for almost 2 hours.
        Code 3 Subcode 2
...
013 (45300.000.000) 03/10 14:09:43 Job was released.
        The job attribute PeriodicRelease expression 'true' evaluated to TRUE
...

The first time the job is held, there is no hold or evict event. The second time the job is held, there is an evict event followed by a hold event.
